description: RHEL 8 CIS Benchmark v4.0.0 - Section 1.1 Filesystem Configuration

controls.title: Ensure cramfs kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install cramfs /bin/false' and 'blacklist cramfs'
controls.description: The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem. Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface.

controls.title: Ensure freevxfs kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install freevxfs /bin/false' and 'blacklist freevxfs'
controls.description: The freevxfs filesystem type is a free version of the Veritas type filesystem. Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface.

controls.title: Ensure hfs kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install hfs /bin/false' and 'blacklist hfs'
controls.description: The hfs filesystem type is a hierarchical filesystem that allows you to mount Mac OS filesystems. Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface.

controls.title: Ensure hfsplus kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install hfsplus /bin/false' and 'blacklist hfsplus'
controls.description: The hfsplus filesystem type is designed to replace hfs that allows you to mount Mac OS filesystems. Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface.

controls.title: Ensure jffs2 kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install jffs2 /bin/false' and 'blacklist jffs2'
controls.description: The jffs2 (journaling flash filesystem 2) filesystem type is a log-structured filesystem used in flash memory devices. Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface.

controls.title: Ensure overlay kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install overlay /bin/false' and 'blacklist overlay'
controls.description: The overlay kernel module allows overlaying one filesystem on top of another. WARNING: Disabling may break container applications like Docker/Kubernetes.

controls.title: Ensure squashfs kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install squashfs /bin/false' and 'blacklist squashfs'
controls.description: The squashfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem. Disabling squashfs will cause Snap packages to fail.

controls.title: Ensure udf kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install udf /bin/false' and 'blacklist udf'
controls.description: The udf filesystem type is the universal disk format used to implement ISO/IEC 13346 and ECMA-167 specifications. Microsoft Azure requires udf.

controls.title: Ensure firewire-core kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install firewire-core /bin/false' and 'blacklist firewire-core'
controls.description: The IEEE 1394 (FireWire) is a serial bus standard for high-speed real-time communication. Disabling FireWire protects against exploitation of flaws.

controls.title: Ensure usb-storage kernel module is not available
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/modprobe.d/ and add 'install usb_storage /bin/false' and 'blacklist usb_storage'
controls.description: USB storage provides means to transfer files. Restricting USB access decreases the physical attack surface and diminishes vectors to introduce malware.

controls.title: Ensure unused filesystems kernel modules are not available
controls.remediation: Review and disable unused filesystem modules: ceph, cifs, exfat, ext, fat, fscache, fuse, gfs2, nfs_common, nfsd, smbfs_common
controls.description: Manual verification required - check for unused filesystem modules with known CVEs and disable per site policy.

controls.title: Ensure /tmp is tmpfs or a separate partition
controls.remediation: Configure /tmp as tmpfs or separate partition in /etc/fstab
controls.description: Making /tmp its own file system allows setting additional mount options such as noexec, making /tmp useless for attackers to install executable code.

controls.title: Ensure nodev option set on /tmp partition
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nodev to /tmp mount options, then run: mount -o remount /tmp
controls.description: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices. Set this option to ensure users cannot create block or character special devices.

controls.title: Ensure nosuid option set on /tmp partition
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nosuid to /tmp mount options, then run: mount -o remount /tmp
controls.description: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files. Set this option to ensure users cannot create setuid files in /tmp.

controls.title: Ensure noexec option set on /tmp partition
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add noexec to /tmp mount options, then run: mount -o remount /tmp
controls.description: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries. Set this option to ensure users cannot run executable binaries from /tmp.
